qas.question: What encoding did early Macs use?
In what years was CP1251 encoding used in most Russian online usage?
When was KO18-R designed by Microsoft?
During what period was MS-DOS created?
What adverse event did the creation of K018-R create?

plausible_answers.text: by establishing different encodings as de facto standards

qas.question: How did the chaos created by the K018-R end?
What did K018-R become a defacto standard in?

context: The Russian alphabet has many systems of character encoding. KOI8-R was designed by <a0_0>the Soviet government<a0_0/> and was intended to serve as the standard encoding. This encoding was and still is widely used in UNIX-like operating systems. Nevertheless, the spread of <a2_0>MS-DOS and OS/2<a2_0/> (IBM866), traditional Macintosh (<a3_0>ISO/IEC 8859-5<a3_0/>) and <a1_0>Microsoft Windows<a1_0/> (CP1251) created <b7_0>chaos<b7_0/> and ended <b8_0>by establishing different encodings as de facto standards<b8_0/>, with Windows-1251 becoming a de facto standard in <b9_0>Russian Internet and e-mail communication<b9_0/> during the period of roughly <a4_0><b5_0><b6_0>1995–2005<b6_0/><b5_0/><a4_0/>.
